trans-unit.source: Provides an object list adapter class for the HTML adapter set.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This class is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlObjectListAdapter"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A value ("__back") that if present in the postback arguments, indicates that the browser should return to top of the list.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This field is used primarily by developers of custom mobile page and control adapters.
To be added.
Returns a strongly typed reference to the associated control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A strongly typed reference to the associated control.
Called by a control to create a templated user interface (UI).
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
If <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>, the instantiated templates bind to available data (which usually happens on the first request).
If <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>, the templates do not bind to data, and instead rely on view state to fill them in (which usually happens on subsequent postbacks).
Returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the event was handled.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is called by a control when it receives a postback event notification, to check whether the event is adapter-specific.
For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.ControlAdapter.HandlePostBackEvent%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
Name of the event.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the event was handled; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The postback data is invalid.

This exception can be caused by data binding the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList"></xref> in the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.OnLoad*> event method without first checking the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.IsPostBack*> property.
Returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if an <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList"></xref> control contains a command.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if an <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList"></xref> control contains a command; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if an <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList"></xref> control contains a default command.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if an <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList"></xref> control contains a default command; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if a <xref uid="langword_csharp_Details" name="Details" href=""></xref> view of an <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList"></xref> control exists.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if a <xref uid="langword_csharp_Details" name="Details" href=""></xref> view of an <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList"></xref> exists; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Called after an object, such as a form or a page, is initialized.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An object (defined by <xref:System.EventArgs>) that contains event data.
Returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if an <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList"></xref> control contains a default command and no other commands.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if an <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList"></xref> control contains a default command and no other commands; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Called by the control's OnPreRender method, to perform adapter-specific work prior to rendering.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An object (defined by <xref:System.EventArgs>) that contains event data.
Called by the control's <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Render*> method to perform rendering.This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The text writer to receive output.
Renders the details of the specified item.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The text writer.
The specified item.
Renders the menu of commands for the specified item.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The text writer.
Returns a <xref uid="langword_csharp_Boolean" name="Boolean" href=""></xref> that indicates whether the list must be rendered as a table.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method can be overridden in order to change the manner in which the list view is rendered.
> [!NOTE] > Even if the ShouldRenderAsTable method returns `true`, the target device might not support tables, in which case the list view will not be rendered as a table.

The ShouldRenderAsTable method returns a `Boolean` that indicates whether the specified table will fit on the target device screen, whereas the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpCapabilitiesBase.Tables%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities> class returns a `Boolean` that indicates whether the device supports tables at all.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the list must be rendered as a table; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
A constant ("__more"), and if present in the postback arguments, indicates that the browser should jump to the first item beyond the currently visible items.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
To be added.
An internal field ("__more*n*"), where *n* is a number, and if present in the postback arguments, indicates that the browser should jump to a specific item in the list.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
To be added.
